newsitem.title: USA: NAL Financial hires ABN AMRO unit.
newsitem.headline: NAL Financial hires ABN AMRO unit.

text.p: NAL Financial Group Inc, a car financing company, said Friday it had hired ABN AMRO Chicago Corp as an adviser to review financial alternatives for the company and evaluate ways of improving shareholder value.
ABN AMRO Chicago is a unit of ABN AMRO Holding NV.
NAL also said that for the first quarter, its origination volume rose to $99.7 million from $57.2 million a year earlier and $97.7 million in the 1996 fourth quarter.
NAL said its dealer network expanded to 2,500 at the end of the first quarter from 2,100 at December 31, 1996.
It said the percentage of delinquencies over 60 days as of March 31 remained "relatively unchanged" from the December 31 level of 4.56 percent.
Recoveries from customers whose accounts have been charged off were $1.3 million for the first quarter, compared with $1.8 million for all of 1996, it said.
NAL said it has begun to make progress in reducing operating expenses by addressing redundancies in staff related to its acquisition of Special Finance Inc.
